commands.summary: Appends provided text to an active printer.

params.summary: The text to append.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Arranges specified characters by X-axis.  When no parameters provided, will execute an auto-arrange evenly distributing visible characters by X-axis.

params.summary: A collection of character ID to scene X-axis position (relative to the left screen border, in percents) named values.  Position 0 relates to the left border and 100 to the right border of the screen; 50 is the center.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Modifies a [background actor](https://naninovel.com/guide/backgrounds.md).

params.summary: Appearance to set for the modified background and name of the [transition effect](https://naninovel.com/guide/background-transition-effects.md) to use.  When transition is not provided, a cross-fade effect will be used by default.
Parameters of the transition effect.

Path to the [custom dissolve](https://naninovel.com/guide/background-transition-effects.md#custom-transition-effects) texture (path should be relative to a `Resources` folder).  Has effect only when the transition is set to `Custom` mode.
ID of the actor to modify.
Appearance to set for the modified actor.

Position (relative to the screen borders, in percents) to set for the modified actor.  Position is described as follows: `0,0` is the bottom left, `50,50` is the center and `100,100` is the top right corner of the screen.
Scale to set for the modified actor.
Position (in world space) to set for the modified actor.
Visibility status to set for the modified actor.
Rotation to set for the modified actor.

Tint color to set for the modified actor.

Strings that begin with `#` will be parsed as hexadecimal in the following way: `#RGB` (becomes RRGGBB), `#RRGGBB`, `#RGBA` (becomes RRGGBBAA), `#RRGGBBAA`; when alpha is not specified will default to FF.

Strings that do not begin with `#` will be parsed as literal colors, with the following supported: red, cyan, blue, darkblue, lightblue, purple, yellow, lime, fuchsia, white, silver, grey, black, orange, brown, maroon, green, olive, navy, teal, aqua, magenta.

Name of the easing function to use for the modification.

Available options: Linear, SmoothStep, Spring, EaseInQuad, EaseOutQuad, EaseInOutQuad, EaseInCubic, EaseOutCubic, EaseInOutCubic, EaseInQuart, EaseOutQuart, EaseInOutQuart, EaseInQuint, EaseOutQuint, EaseInOutQuint, EaseInSine, EaseOutSine, EaseInOutSine, EaseInExpo, EaseOutExpo, EaseInOutExpo, EaseInCirc, EaseOutCirc, EaseInOutCirc, EaseInBounce, EaseOutBounce, EaseInOutBounce, EaseInBack, EaseOutBack, EaseInOutBack, EaseInElastic, EaseOutElastic, EaseInOutElastic.

When not specified, will use a default easing function set in the actor's manager configuration settings.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Plays or modifies currently played BGM (background music) track with the provided name.

params.summary: Path to the music track to play.
Volume of the music track.
Whether to play the track from beginning when it finishes.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Adds a line break to the text in active printer.

params.summary: Number of line breaks to add.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Modifies the main camera, changing offset, zoom level and rotation over time.  Check [this video](https://youtu.be/zy28jaMss8w) for a quick demonstration of the command effect.

params.summary: Local camera position offset in units by X and Y axis.
Local camera rotation by Z-axis in angle degrees (0.0 to 360.0 or -180.0 to 180.0).
Relatize camera zoom (orthographic size scale), in 0.0 to 1.0 range.

Names of the components to toggle (enable if disabled and vice-versa). The components should be attached to the same gameobject as the camera.  This can be used to toggle [custom post-processing effects](https://naninovel.com/guide/special-effects.md#camera-effects).

Name of the easing function to use for the modification.

Available options: Linear, SmoothStep, Spring, EaseInQuad, EaseOutQuad, EaseInOutQuad, EaseInCubic, EaseOutCubic, EaseInOutCubic, EaseInQuart, EaseOutQuart, EaseInOutQuart, EaseInQuint, EaseOutQuint, EaseInOutQuint, EaseInSine, EaseOutSine, EaseInOutSine, EaseInExpo, EaseOutExpo, EaseInOutExpo, EaseInCirc, EaseOutCirc, EaseInOutCirc, EaseInBounce, EaseOutBounce, EaseInOutBounce, EaseInBack, EaseOutBack, EaseInOutBack, EaseInElastic, EaseOutElastic, EaseInOutElastic.

When not specified, will use a default easing function set in the camera configuration settings.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Modifies a [character actor](https://naninovel.com/guide/characters.md).

params.summary: ID of the actor to modify and the appearance to set.  When appearance is not provided, will use either a `Default` (is exists) or a random one.
Look direction of the actor; possible options: left, right, center.
Name (path) of the [avatar texture](https://naninovel.com/guide/characters.md#avatar-textures) to assign for the character.  Use `none` to remove (un-assign) avatar texture from the character.
ID of the actor to modify.
Appearance to set for the modified actor.

Position (relative to the screen borders, in percents) to set for the modified actor.  Position is described as follows: `0,0` is the bottom left, `50,50` is the center and `100,100` is the top right corner of the screen.
Scale to set for the modified actor.
Position (in world space) to set for the modified actor.
Visibility status to set for the modified actor.
Rotation to set for the modified actor.

Tint color to set for the modified actor.

Strings that begin with `#` will be parsed as hexadecimal in the following way: `#RGB` (becomes RRGGBB), `#RRGGBB`, `#RGBA` (becomes RRGGBBAA), `#RRGGBBAA`; when alpha is not specified will default to FF.

Strings that do not begin with `#` will be parsed as literal colors, with the following supported: red, cyan, blue, darkblue, lightblue, purple, yellow, lime, fuchsia, white, silver, grey, black, orange, brown, maroon, green, olive, navy, teal, aqua, magenta.

Name of the easing function to use for the modification.

Available options: Linear, SmoothStep, Spring, EaseInQuad, EaseOutQuad, EaseInOutQuad, EaseInCubic, EaseOutCubic, EaseInOutCubic, EaseInQuart, EaseOutQuart, EaseInOutQuart, EaseInQuint, EaseOutQuint, EaseInOutQuint, EaseInSine, EaseOutSine, EaseInOutSine, EaseInExpo, EaseOutExpo, EaseInOutExpo, EaseInCirc, EaseOutCirc, EaseInOutCirc, EaseInBounce, EaseOutBounce, EaseInOutBounce, EaseInBack, EaseOutBack, EaseInOutBack, EaseInElastic, EaseOutElastic, EaseInOutElastic.

When not specified, will use a default easing function set in the actor's manager configuration settings.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Adds a choice option to an active (or default) choice handler actor.

params.summary: Text to show for the choice.  When the text contain spaces, wrap it in double quotes (`"`).  In case you wish to include the double quotes in the text itself, escape them.

Path (relative to a `Resources` folder) to a [button prefab](https://naninovel.com/guide/choices.md#choice-button) representing the choice.  The prefab should have a `ChoiceHandlerButton` component attached to the root object.  Will use a default button when not provided.
Local position of the choice button inside the choice handler (if supported by the handler implementation).
ID of the choice handler to add choice for.
Path to go when the choice is selected by user;  See [`@goto`](https://naninovel.com/api/#goto) command for the path format.
Set expression to execute when the choice is selected by user;  see [`@set`](https://naninovel.com/api/#set) command for syntax reference.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Removes all the messages from [printer backlog](https://naninovel.com/guide/printer-backlog.md).

params.summary: Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Destroys object spawned with [`@spawn`](https://naninovel.com/api/#spawn) command.

params.summary: Path to the prefab resource to destroy. Path is relative to a `./Resources` folder, eg  given a `Assets/Resources/FX/Explosion.prefab` asset, use the following path to spawn it: `FX/Explosion`.  A [`@spawn`](https://naninovel.com/api/#spawn) command with the same path is expected to be executed before.
Parameters to set before destoying the prefab.  Requires the prefab to have a `Naninovel.Commands.DestroySpawned.IParameterized` component attached the root object.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Marks a branch of a conditional execution block,  which is always executed in case conditions of the opening [`@if`](https://naninovel.com/api/#if) and all the preceding [`@elseif`](https://naninovel.com/api/#elseif) (if any) commands are not met.  For usage examples see [conditional execution](https://naninovel.com/guide/naninovel-scripts.md#conditional-execution) guide.

params.summary: Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Marks a branch of a conditional execution block,  which is executed in case own condition is met (expression is evaluated to be true), while conditions of the opening [`@if`](https://naninovel.com/api/#if)  and all the preceding [`@elseif`](https://naninovel.com/api/#elseif) (if any) commands are not met.  For usage examples see [conditional execution](https://naninovel.com/guide/naninovel-scripts.md#conditional-execution) guide.

params.summary: A [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), which should return a boolean value.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Closes an [`@if`](https://naninovel.com/api/#if) conditional execution block.  For usage examples see [conditional execution](https://naninovel.com/guide/naninovel-scripts.md#conditional-execution) guide.

params.summary: Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Spawns a [special effect](https://naninovel.com/guide/special-effects.md) prefab stored in `./Resources/Naninovel/FX` resources folder.

params.summary: Path to the prefab resource to spawn. Path is relative to a `./Resources` folder, eg  given a `Assets/Resources/FX/Explosion.prefab` asset, use the following path to spawn it: `FX/Explosion`.
Parameters to set when spawning the prefab.  Requires the prefab to have a `Naninovel.Commands.Spawn.IParameterized` component attached the root object.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Jumps the naninovel script playback to the provided path and saves the path to the global state;  [`@return`](https://naninovel.com/api/#return) commands use this info to redirect to command after the last invoked gosub command.  Resembles a function (subroutine) in a programming language, allowing to reuse a piece of naninovel script.  Useful for invoking a repeating set of commands multiple times.

params.summary: Path to jump into in the following format: `ScriptName.LabelName`.  When label name is ommited, will play provided script from the start.  When script name is ommited, will attempt to find a label in the currently played script.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Jumps the naninovel script playback to the provided path.  When the path leads to another (not the currently played) naninovel script, will also [reset state](https://naninovel.com/api/#resetstate)  before loading the target script, unless [ResetStateOnLoad](https://naninovel.com/guide/configuration.html#state) is disabled in the configuration.

params.summary: Path to jump into in the following format: `ScriptName.LabelName`.  When label name is ommited, will play provided script from the start.  When script name is ommited, will attempt to find a label in the currently played script.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Hides (removes from scene) an actor with provided ID.

Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Holds script execution until user activates a `continue` input.  Shortcut for `@wait input`.

params.summary: Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Marks the beginning of a conditional execution block.  Should always be closed with an [`@endif`](https://naninovel.com/api/#endif) command.  For usage examples see [conditional execution](https://naninovel.com/guide/naninovel-scripts.md#conditional-execution) guide.

params.summary: A [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), which should return a boolean value.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Shows an input field UI where user can enter an arbitrary text.  Upon submit the entered text will be assigned to the specified custom variable.

params.summary: Name of a custom variable to which the entered text will be assigned.
An optional summary text to show along with input field.  When the text contain spaces, wrap it in double quotes (`"`).  In case you wish to include the double quotes in the text itself, escape them.
Whether to automatically resume script playback when user submits the input form.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Sets an [unlockable item](https://naninovel.com/guide/unlockable-items.md) with the provided ID to `locked` state.

params.summary: ID of the unlockable item. Use `all` to lock all the registered unlockable items.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Resets the active printer, prints text message and waits for user input.

params.summary: Text of the message to print.  When the text contain spaces, wrap it in double quotes (`"`).  In case you wish to include the double quotes in the text itself, escape them.
ID of the printer actor to use.
ID of the actor, which should be associated with the printed message.
Whether to reset text of the printer before executing the printing task.
Whether to wait for user input after finishing the printing task.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

params.summary: ID of the printer to activate.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Allows halting and resuming user input processing (eg, reacting to pressing keyboard keys).  The effect of the action is persistent and saved with the game.

params.summary: Whether to enable input processing.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Resets state of all the [engine services](https://naninovel.com/guide/engine-services.html) and unloads (disposes)  all the resources loaded by Naninovel (textures, audio, video, etc); will basically revert to an empty initial engine state.

params.summary: Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

params.summary: Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.

A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Attempts to jump the naninovel script playback to the command after the last used @gosub.  When the target command is not in the currently played script, will also [reset state](https://naninovel.com/api/#resetstate)  before loading the target script, unless [ResetStateOnLoad](https://naninovel.com/guide/configuration.html#state) is disabled in the configuration.  See [`@gosub`](https://naninovel.com/api/#gosub) command summary for more info and usage examples.

params.summary: Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Assigns result of a [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md) to a [custom variable](https://naninovel.com/guide/custom-variables.md).

params.summary:
Set expression.

The expression should be in the following format: `VariableName=ExpressionBody`, where `VariableName` is the name of the custom variable to assign and `ExpressionBody` is a [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), the result of which should be assigned to the variable.
Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Stops [special effect](https://naninovel.com/guide/special-effects.md) started with [`@fx`](https://naninovel.com/api/#fx) command by destroying spawned object of the corresponding FX prefab.

Path is relative to a `./Resources` folder, eg  given a `Assets/Resources/FX/Explosion.prefab` asset, use the following path to spawn it: `FX/Explosion`.  A [`@spawn`](https://naninovel.com/api/#spawn) command with the same path is expected to be executed before.
Parameters to set before destoying the prefab.  Requires the prefab to have a `Naninovel.Commands.DestroySpawned.IParameterized` component attached the root object.

Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.md), controlling whether this command should execute.

commands.summary: Stops playing an SFX (sound effect) track with the provided name.

commands.summary: Holds script execution until the specified wait condition.

params.summary:
Wait conditions:
- `i` user press continue or skip input key;
- `0.0` timer (seconds);
- `i0.0` timer, that is skippable by continue or skip input keys.
Holds script execution until the specified wait condition.
Determines for how long (in seconds) command should execute. Derived commands could (or could not) use this parameter.
